member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDataProgressMessage
member.summary: Data associated with an executing data operation to report status updates or errors related to progress.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDataProgressMessage.Progress
member.summary: Current progress in percent complete.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDataProgressMessage.SchemaName
member.summary: The schema name of the table whose progress is being reported.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDataProgressMessage.TableName
member.summary: The name of the table whose progress is being reported.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions
member.summary: Defines options that affect the behavior of package deployment to a database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AdditionalDeploymentContributorPaths
member.summary: Specifies paths to load additional deployment contributors. This should be a semi-colon delimited list of values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AdditionalDeploymentContributors
member.summary: Specifies additional deployment contributors which should run - in addition to those specified in the dacpac.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AdditionalDeploymentContributorArguments
member.summary: Specifies additional deployment contributor arguments in addition to those already listed in the dacpac.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AllowDropBlockingAssemblies
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether CLR deployment will cause blocking assemblies to be dropped.
member.value: True to drop blocking assemblies during CLR deployment; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AllowExternalLanguagePaths
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether file paths should be used for external language deployment.
member.value: True to use file paths (instead of content) for external languages; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AllowExternalLibraryPaths
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether file paths should be used for external library deployment.
member.value: True to use file paths (instead of content) for external libraries; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AllowIncompatiblePlatform
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether deployment will block due to platform compatibility.
member.value: True to allow deployment to incompatible platforms; otherwise, deployment will not proceed for incompatible platforms. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.BackupDatabaseBeforeChanges
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether a database backup will be performed before proceeding with the actual deployment actions.
member.value: True to perform a database backup prior to deployment; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.BlockOnPossibleDataLoss
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether deployment should stop if the operation could cause data loss.
member.value: True to stop deployment if possible data loss if detected; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.BlockWhenDriftDetected
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether the system will check for differences between the present state of the database and the registered state of the database and block deployment if changes are detected. Even if this option is set to true, drift detection will only occur on a database if it was previously deployed with the option enabled.
member.value: True to error is drift is detected; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AzureStorageBlobEndpoint
member.summary: [Preview] Azure storage blob endpoint of Azure Storage Account to import data from Parquet files.
member.value: Set this for deploy operation. Default value is null

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AzureStorageContainer
member.summary: [Preview] Azure storage container name of Azure Storage Account to import data from parquet files.
member.value: Set this for deploy operation. Default value is null

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AzureStorageKey
member.summary: [Preview] Azure storage key of Azure Storage Account to import data from Parquet files.
member.value: Set this for deploy operation to authenticate with the storage account key. Default value is null

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AzureStorageRootPath
member.summary: [Preview] The storage root path under the container of Azure Storage Account to import data from Parquet files.
member.value: Set this for deploy operation. Default value is null

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AzureSharedAccessSignatureToken
member.summary: [Preview] Azure Shared Access Signature token of Azure Storage Account to import data from Parquet files. Specify a valid SAS token with access to the storage container path to authenticate with using Shared Access Signature identity.
member.value: Set this for deploy operation. Default value is null

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DataOperationStateProvider
member.summary: Data operation state provider.
member.value: if not null, use parquet file format; otherwise, null. Default is null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.CommentOutSetVarDeclarations
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether the declaration of SQLCMD variables are commented out in the script header.
member.value: True to comment out these declarations; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.CompareUsingTargetCollation
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether the target collation will be used for identifier comparison.
member.value: False to use the source collation; otherwise, true to use the target collation. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.CreateNewDatabase
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether the existing database will be dropped and a new database created before proceeding with the actual deployment actions. Acquires single-user mode before dropping the existing database.
member.value: True to drop and re-create the database; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DatabaseSpecification
member.summary: Defines optional parameters specific to a Microsoft Azure SQL Database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DeployDatabaseInSingleUserMode
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether the system will acquire single-user mode on the target database during the duration of the deployment operation.
member.value: True to acquire single-user mode during deployment; otherwise, false. Default is false.
member.remarks: The database will be returned to multi-user mode after all changes are applied. Database may remain in single-user mode if an error occurs during execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IsAlwaysEncryptedParameterizationEnabled
member.summary: Set Always Encrypted Parameterization Mode
member.value: True to enable parameterization variables in post/pre deployment scripts Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DisableAndReenableDdlTriggers
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies if all DDL triggers will be disabled for the duration of the deployment operation and then re-enabled after all changes are applied.
member.value: True to disable DDL triggers during deployment; otherwise, false. Default is true.
member.remarks: Triggers may remain disabled if an error occurs during execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DoNotAlterChangeDataCaptureObjects
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether items configured for Change Data Capture (CDC) should be altered during deployment.
member.value: True to not alter objects configured for CDC; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DoNotAlterReplicatedObjects
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether items configured for Replication should be altered during deployment.
member.value: True to not alter objects configured for Replication; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DoNotDropObjectTypes
member.summary: Get or set a collection of object types that will not be dropped from the target when no corresponding object exists in the source. Note that dropping and recreating objects of the specified type may still be necessary due to dependencies from other objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DropConstraintsNotInSource
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to drop all constraints that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to drop constraints not in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is true.
member.remarks: This applies to check, default, foreign key, primary key, and unique constraints.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DropDmlTriggersNotInSource
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to drop all DML triggers that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to drop DML triggers not in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreDatabaseWorkloadGroups
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude Database Workload Groups that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to exclude Database Workload Groups in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreWorkloadClassifiers
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude WorkloadClassifiers that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to exclude WorkloadClassifiers in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DropExtendedPropertiesNotInSource
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to drop all extended properties that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to drop extended properties not in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.AllowTableRecreation
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to allow the table recreation in publish
member.value: Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DropIndexesNotInSource
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to drop all indexes that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to drop indexes not in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DropObjectsNotInSource
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether objects that exist in the target but not source should be dropped during deployment.
member.value: True if objects that exist in the target but not source should be dropped; otherwise false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DropPermissionsNotInSource
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to drop all permissions that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to drop permissions not in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DropRoleMembersNotInSource
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to drop all role memberships that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to drop role memberships not in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DropStatisticsNotInSource
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to drop all role memberships that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to drop role memberships not in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DoNotDropDatabaseWorkloadGroups
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to drop all database workload groups that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to drop database workload groups not in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DoNotDropWorkloadClassifiers
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to drop all database workload groups that do not exist in the source model.
member.value: True to drop database workload classifiers not in the source model; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.EnclaveAttestationUrl
member.summary: Specifies the enclave attestation Url (an attestation service endpoint) to be used with enclave based Always Encrypted.
member.remarks: DacFx must enable ColumnEncryptionSetting and correctly set both this and on the connection string to enable Always Encrypted with secure enclaves during deploy operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.EnclaveAttestationProtocol
member.summary: Specifies an attestation protocol to be used with enclave based Always Encrypted.
member.remarks: DacFx must enable ColumnEncryptionSetting and correctly set both this and on the connection string to enable Always Encrypted with secure enclaves during deploy operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.GenerateSmartDefaults
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether default values should be generated to populate NULL columns that are constrained to NOT NULL values.
member.value: True if default values should be generated; otherwise false. Default is false.
member.remarks: This is useful when needing to add a new NOT NULL column to an existing table with data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.HashObjectNamesInLogs
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to hash object names in logs
member.value: True to replace all object names in logs with a random hash value; otherwise, false. Default is false

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreAnsiNulls
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude the ANSI_NULL option from consideration when comparing the source and target model.
member.value: True to ignore differences in the ANSI_NULL option; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreAuthorizer
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude the AUTHORIZATION option from consideration when comparing the source and target model.
member.value: True to ignore differences in the AUTHORIZATION option; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreColumnCollation
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude the collation specifier from consideration when comparing the source and target model.
member.value: True to ignore differences in the collation specifier; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreColumnOrder
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude from consideration the order of columns in tables when comparing the source and target model.
member.value: True to ignore differences in column order; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreComments
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude comments from consideration when comparing the source and target model.
member.value: True to ignore differences in comments; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreCryptographicProviderFilePath
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude the file specification of a cryptographic provider from consideration when comparing the source and target model.
member.value: True to ignore differences in a cryptographic provider's file specification; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreDdlTriggerOrder
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude DDL trigger order from consideration when comparing the source and target model.
member.value: True to ignore differences in DDL trigger order; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreDdlTriggerState
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude DDL trigger state from consideration when comparing the source and target model.
member.value: True to ignore differences in DDL trigger state; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreDefaultSchema
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude the DEFAULT_SCHEMA option from consideration when comparing the source and target model.
member.value: True to ignore differences in the DEFAULT_SCHEMA options; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreDmlTriggerOrder
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude DML trigger order from consideration when comparing the source and target model.
member.value: True to ignore differences in DDL trigger order; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.IgnoreDmlTriggerState
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to exclude DML trigger state from consideration when comparing the source and target model.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.ScriptRefreshModule

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.TreatVerificationErrorsAsWarnings
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether to treat errors that occur during publish verification as warnings. The check is performed against the generated deployment plan before the plan is executed against the target database. Plan verification detects problems, such as the loss of target-only objects (for example, indexes), that must be dropped to make a change. Verification also detects situations where dependencies (such as tables or views) exist because of a reference to a composite project, but do not exist in the target database. You might choose to treat verification errors as warnings to get a complete list of issues instead of allowing the publish action to stop when the first error occurs.
member.value: True to treat errors as warnings; otherwise, false. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.RebuildIndexesOfflineForDataPhase
member.summary: Gets or set a boolean that specifies if indexes should be rebuilt offline after importing data into SQL Server.
member.value: True to rebuild indexes offline after importing data. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.RestoreSequenceCurrentValue
member.summary: Gets or set a boolean that specifies if sequence value should be enabled or disabled before deploying the script into SQL Server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DisableIndexesForDataPhase
member.summary: Gets or set a boolean that specifies if indexes should be disabled before importing data into SQL Server.
member.value: False to leave indexes enabled while importing data. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.DisableParallelismForEnablingIndexes
member.summary: Gets or set a boolean that specifies if rebuilding indexes should not use parallelism for importing data into SQL Server.
member.value: Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.UnmodifiableObjectWarnings
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether warnings should be generated when differences are found in objects that cannot be modified, for example, if the file size or file paths were different for a file.
member.value: True to generate warnings; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.VerifyCollationCompatibility

member.value: True to continue if errors are generated during plan verification; otherwise, false. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.VerifyDeployment
member.summary: Get or set boolean that specifies whether the plan verification phase is executed or not.
member.value: True to perform plan verification; otherwise, false to skip it. Default is true.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacDeployOptions.InitializeDefaults(Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.Sql.Deployment.SqlDeploymentOptions)
member.summary: Initialize the expected defaults for this API.
member.remarks: Only defined where default values differ from the core defaults. When new options are added to SqlDeploymentOptions or a default value changed, all clients must determine if they must override the default. Redundantly specifying existing defaults doesn't reduce need for this process when adding options or changing defaults. Unit tests should be employed to validating expectations for each deployment client that overrides default options (e.g. power-buffer, schema-compare, this api). When removing or renaming an option, the compiler will complain (good).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacExportOptions.TargetEngineVersion
member.summary: Specifies what the target engine version is expected to be. This is used during export to define the allowed engine version to validate against and whether the features of the database match the capabilities of that engine version.
member.value:
The latest version of Azure contains support for additional capabilities. When this value is or , the export operation will fail if the target database is found to contain any objects that require a newer engine version.
The default value for this option is , which means that validation will ensure that the export operation will only fail if the target database is found to contain any objects that are not supported in the latest engine version.

member.value: True if the package should be verified; otherwise false. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.DacExportOptions.IgnoreIndexesStatisticsOnEnclaveEnabledColumns

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Represents an option specifying what engine version should be set or allowed. Currently this option is only used in operations related to Microsoft Azure SQL Database.
For instance this can be used during export to define the allowed engine version to validate against and whether the features of the database match the capabilities of that engine version.
Similarly when defining creation options for a public TSqlModel in the extensibility APIs, this can be used to define what the expected engine version of the model should be set to.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.EngineVersion.Default
member.summary: Use the default engine version when creating the model.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.EngineVersion.Latest
member.summary: Use the latest engine version when creating the model. This will always attempt to set the highest supported engine version as the target, and will mean that the model will allow the latest set of T-SQL language features to be supported

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.KeyVault.KeyVaultAuthenticator
member.summary: Base class for any Azure Key Vault authentication provider. This is responsible for logging into Azure, obtaining access keys and returning to the caller. Notes: Only one provider is allowed per process, with the first to register being the successful provider. In order to support and related APIs being used in multiple UI tools and the SqlPackage command line the binding to Azure Authentication DLLs is loosely coupled to the core Dac Framework using MEF. A default provider is available for use in SqlPackage and other command line scenarios, supporting basic credential based authentication. This can be overridden in order to integrate with custom authentication pipelines or into your UI application by extending this method and providing an with typeof(KeyVaultAuthenticator), a unique ID and high priority

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.Operation.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.Sql.Common.DacFxOperationTelemetry,Microsoft.Data.Tools.Schema.Common.Telemetry.TelemetryOperationName,System.Action{System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken})
member.summary: Construct a new instance of the class.
member.param: String describing the operation, suitable for display to user.

Delegate to invoke when the operation is executed.
The first parameter of the delegate is an opaque object that represents the operation. A concrete example of its usage is as the sender for events fired (indirectly) by this operation in order to correlate these events to the operation.
The second parameter is a nullable that can be used to signal that the operation should be cancelled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dac.PublishOptions.MasterDbScriptPath

This script is only created if Azure SQL DB is the target as USE statements are not supported on that platform. It contains all operations that must be done against the master database, for instance Create Database statements
